messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Off Topic: 'a chronic deficiency of	calcium is largely responsible forpremenstrual syndrome (PMS)'
messages.msgSnippet: ... Why would bodies evolve to need a substance that isn t readily available? Did humanity originate in an area that had abundant coral calcium? But the people
messages.messageBody:
on 12/11/02 7:31 PM, Barda A. Allen at HeavensOnEarth@... wrote:

> Among the reasons for their longevity of life and
> overall health cited by the study was 'the high
> calcium intake by Okinawans in both food and
> their natural drinking water.' The coral calcium in
> their water has played a key role.

Why would bodies evolve to need a substance that isn't readily available?
Did humanity originate in an area that had abundant coral calcium?

But the people who live in areas where milk can be stored developed a
tolerance to lactose. That can't have taken more than a few thousand years.
Why would humans who haven't lived near the sea for 10's of thousands of
years still be dependent on coral calcium?

Joyce

messages.subject: Off Topic: 'a chronic deficiency of calcium is largely	responsible forpremenstrual syndrome (PMS)'
messages.msgSnippet: I m past the point of  PMS in my life, but I m up for living to one hundred years old! CORAL CALCIUM! Wow! Well, we all know now about osteoporosis and bone
messages.messageBody:
I'm past the point of PMS in my life, but I'm up for living to one hundred
years old!


CORAL CALCIUM!

Wow!

Well, we all know now about osteoporosis and bone
support, blood vessels and circulation, teeth and
how important good quality calcium is for dealing
with the above and more.

But I did not know that research says it might help
with such things as colon cancer and prolong your
life in general! That just BLEW ME AWAY!

This whole Coral Calcium thing is IMPORTANT for
every single woman on the planet. But, of course,
you already know that without me, right? :-)

So, please, read the following article and share
it with everyone you care about or who you know has
any of the mentioned conditions and could profit
from the below information.

Enjoy! And let me know what you think, please.

With Love,
Barda

P.S.: For those of you who are interested in getting
some Coral Calcium of truly superior quality and at
an incredibly low price (that was discovered during
long and detailed search by your obedient servant :-),
there is a link and a code for you at the end of this
e-mail.

Once again, Enjoy! And stay HEALTHY and HAPPY!

Happy Holidays and Holydays! :-)



====================================

-- The Okinawan Centenarian Study

Here's the link to the Okinawa study, followed by
a brief summary and some additional stuff I've run
across about calcium:

<a href='http://www.okinawaprogram.com/'>
http://www.okinawaprogram.com/ </a>

According to The Okinawan Centenarian Study,
every city, town, and village In Okinawa has a
family register system (koseki) that has been
recording reliable birth, marriage, and death
statistics since 1879. Life tables calculated from
this database show one of the world's highest
concentrations of centenarians and likely the
world's longest life expectancy for any country or
state.

After examining over six hundred Okinawan
centenarians and numerous 'youngsters' in their
seventies, eighties, and nineties, the researchers
saw certain patterns begin to emerge. It became
clear that the Okinawan lifestyle was providing
some real, scientifically verifiable reasons these
people were so incredibly healthy so far into their
senior years. And they were reasons that could
have a profound impact on our health and well-
being here in the West.

_________________

Among the reasons for their longevity of life and
overall health cited by the study was 'the high
calcium intake by Okinawans in both food and
their natural drinking water.' The coral calcium in
their water has played a key role.
_________________


This is right in line with numerous studies that are
beginning to point to the significant benefits of
calcium. In the October 13, 1998 issue of the New
York Times wrote an article appeared entitled
'Calcium Takes Its Place As a Superstar of
Nutrients' in which it reports that a study
published in the Journal of the American Medical
Association reported that 'increasing calcium
induced normal development of the epithelia cells
and might also prevent cancer in such organs as the
breast, prostate and pancreas'. It also reported that
the American Journal of Clinical Nutrition published
'virtually no major organ system escapes calcium's
influence' and that a research team from the
University of Southern California found 'adding
calcium to the diet lowered the blood pressure in
110 black teenagers.'

The January 14, 1999 issue of the Phoenix Republic
wrote an article about cancer entitled 'Calcium
Reduces Tumors' that the New England Journal of
Medicine reported 'adding calcium to the diet can
keep you from getting tumors in your large
intestine'. Then the February, 1999 issue of the
Readers Digest wrote in an article entitled 'The
'Superstar Nutrient' that the Journal of the
American Medical published 'when the participants
consumption reached 1500 milligrams of calcium a
day, cell growth in the colon improved toward
normal (this means that the cancer was reversed)'.
The Digest also reported that the Metabolic Bone
Center at St. Lukes Hospital believes that 'a chronic
deficiency of calcium is largely responsible for
premenstrual syndrome (PMS)' and that 'a lot of
women are avoiding the sun and their vitamin-D
levels may be very low.'

For more, go here:

<a href='http://www.okinawaprogram.com'>
http://www.okinawaprogram.com </a>
______________________________________________



~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


AS PROMISED:

Here is the link for THE BEST ( in my and not only MY
opinion) and most affordable Coral Calcium available:

http://www.vitacorp.com/products/coralcalcium.asp

During the 'Check Out' you'll be asked your sponsor's ID#
Just enter 821261 and you are all set! :-)

And as always, I'm anxious to hear about your thoughts,
feelings and experiences.

All the best!

Barda Allen


315 State Street
Helena, MT 59601
406-449-7513
HeavensOnEarth@...

I just got back home from my House Special at The General Mercantile.

The Merc makes coffee the slow way, using a 1950's
Italian LaPavoni
Espresso Machine.

My House Special is alot like "Shipping" . It is slow...

I wouldn't want it any other way.

What is the "Shipping" Business?
